title: [Nuxt - Pinia - Tailwind] Get org repos

title: [WIP] [Angular - NgRx - SCSS] Single Repo API Setup
body:
Closes issue #183 

There's a few things still to decide on and solve for this.
- Ran into some issues with testing for the username (it ends up being a nested property in the call), but I think even if we don't pull that info from this call, we'll already have it for the user. Just needs to actually be set when the UI is set up. I think that field can either be deleted from the AC or else I'll add it in when I come back.
- The other unmarked fields will all require extra fetch calls, since we're using the REST API. Decisions on which we want and which we don't will need to be made. This PR isn't fully ready until those choices are made.  

Acceptance criteria from ticket:

data needed:
- [ ]  username
- [x]  repo name
- [x]  visibility badge (public / private)
- [x]  watch count
- [x]  star count
- [x]  fork count
- [x]  issue count
- [ ]  pull request count
- [ ]  branch names
- [x]  about description
- [x]  about website link (if available)
- [ ]  root tree information (folders and files)
- [ ]  readme information

title: [Nuxt - Pinia - Tailwind] Get all user repos

title: [Remix + GraphQL + Tailwind] Add husky and lint-staged
body: As observed [here](https://github.com/thisdot/starter.dev-github-showcases/pull/296#issuecomment-1152729316), the `.prettierrc` rules are being ignored in some PRs because it's not being enforced. Other linting violations could be getting in too. The Remix project should add husky and lint-staged to enforce consistency whenever someone tries to commit a file to the showcase.

title: [CRA-RXJS-SC] Create user profile card
body:
## Background

As a user, when I visit my profile page I should see my profile information displayed. This ticket is intended to handle specifically the user information section, showing details about the user.

## Acceptance

- [ ] user picture in circle shape
- [ ] display name
- [ ] username / login name
- [ ] description
- [ ] number of followers with people icon
- [ ] number of people following
- [ ] star icon with star count
- [ ] building icon with company name
- [ ] map marker icon with location
- [ ] link icon with blog / website
- [ ] divider
- [ ] organizations title
- [ ] any organizations will show as a square button with the org logo, that will navigate to the organization page when clicked

## Notes

title: [CRA-RXJS-SC] Create main page layout
body:
## Background

As a user, my main page view should show me my gists and top repositories.

## Acceptance


 - [x] 2 column layout
 - [x] Left side
    - [x] gists panel
 - [x] Right side
    - [x] Top repositories title
    - [x] card for each of the users’ top repos
    - [ ] view all repositories button that navigates to user profile page

## Notes

title: [CRA-RXJS-SC] Get pull request information from GitHub API
body:
## Background

On the single repo page, we’ll have a tab for viewing open and closed pull requests. We do not (currently) have the functionality to click into the PRs, so this ticket will be for creating the initial view that mostly concerns the name of the PR and some metadata about each one.

## Acceptance

- [ ] Get repository pull requests from GitHub API
- [ ] For display in pull request tab on single repository page; data needed:
    - [ ] name of PR
    - [ ] PR number
    - [ ] name of person who created it
    - [ ] created / closed date
    - [ ] number of comments

## Notes

title: [nuxt-pinia-tailwind] Get issue information from GitHub API
body:
## Background

On the single repo page, we’ll have a tab for viewing open and closed issues. We do not (currently) have the functionality to click into the issues, so this ticket will be for creating the initial view that mostly concerns the name of the issue and some metadata about each one.

## Acceptance

- [ ] Get repository issues from GitHub API
- [ ] For display in issues tab on single repository page; data needed:
    - [ ] name of issue
    - [ ] issue number
    - [ ] name of person who created the issue
    - [ ] created / closed date
    - [ ] number of comments

## Notes

title: [nuxt-pinia-tailwind] Get single repo information from GitHub API
body:
## Background

We want to create a view for an individual repository. It will share a similar look to the same page on GitHub, but with slightly fewer features.

## Acceptance

- [ ] Get single repository information from GitHub API
- [ ] For display on single repository page; data needed:
    - [ ] username 
    - [ ] repo name
    - [ ] visibility badge (public / private)
    - [ ] watch count
    - [ ] star count
    - [ ] fork count
    - [ ] issue count
    - [ ] pull request count
    - [ ] branch names
    - [ ] about description
    - [ ] about website link (if available)
    - [ ] root tree information (folders and files)
    - [ ] readme information

## Notes

title: [nuxt-pinia-tailwind] Get Organization repositories from GitHub API
body:
## Background

There will be a view for an organization’s profile, which, similar to the user’s profile, will list all of the organization’s repositories.

## Acceptance

- [ ] Get organization repositories from GitHub API
- [ ] For display on organization page; data needed:
    - [ ] Repo name
    - [ ] description
    - [ ] language
    - [ ] star count
    - [ ] fork count
    - [ ] last updated
    - [ ] visibility tag

## Notes

- This query should start sorted by most recently updated.

title: [nuxt-pinia-tailwind] Get all repositories from GitHub API
body:
## Background

On a user’s profile page, we want to list out ALL of their repositories - not just the top ones. This ticket will be to get the data on all of a user’s repos for display on the profile page. 

## Acceptance

- [ ] Get all repositories from GitHub API
- [ ] For display on profile page; data needed:
    - [ ] Repo name
    - [ ] description
    - [ ] language
    - [ ] star count
    - [ ] fork count
    - [ ] last updated
    - [ ] visibility tag

## Notes

- This query should start sorted by most recently updated.

title: [nuxt-pinia-tailwind] get profile information from GitHub API
body:
## Background

For the profile page, we want to fairly closely resemble the GitHub user page. This section is focused on the user “card”, where you can see profile information about the user.

## Acceptance

- [ ] Get user info from GitHub API
- [ ] For display on profile page; data needed:
    - [ ] Photo
    - [ ] Name (display name)
    - [ ] username (login name)
    - [ ] description
    - [ ] followers
    - [ ] following
    - [ ] stars
    - [ ] company info
    - [ ] location info
    - [ ] blog link
    - [ ] organizations (need name and avatar)

## Notes

title: [Angular - NgRx - SCSS] Adjust log in logic to persist authentication status
body:
Because the urls for the deploy preview and the signIn redirect (which is hard coded in the env variables) are different, the NgRx store doesn’t persist across them, and so the calls to set a user as authenticated and to store the session cookie don’t work. It’s fine locally and on the fully deployed instance since those urls will match, but will prevent the previews from letting anyone log in. 

Will need some discussion on how best to adjust for this for deploy previews:
- Get the current url dynamically, and use that instead of hard coding the url paths?
- Move the logic that saves the session cookie to a route guard or something similar, and adjust the store logic to check for the cookie first?
- Move all auth logic out of the NgRx store and make it local / cookie based?

Not sure the best path forward. But the deploy previews would be helpful enough for reviewing that finding a solution for this is worth figuring out.

title: [vue3-apollo-quasar] update deployment DNS to be vue3-apollo-quasar.starter.dev
[CRA-RxJS-SC] create file view
body:
## Background

As a user, if I’m viewing a single repository and click on an individual file, I am navigated to a single page view of that file. This should look similar to how a file would look on GitHub itself.

## Acceptance

- [ ] clicking on a file in a repo displays that file

## Notes

title: [CRA-RxJS-SC] create repo folder navigation
body:
## Background

This is intended to be a reusable component, focused on building the structure for a given repository folder. It can contain any number of directories or files, with matching icons. When a user clicks on a folder, it will navigate into that folder. 

## Acceptance

- [ ] users can navigate through a repository’s structure and view files
- [ ] clicking on a folder navigates into that folder and shows any folders and files

## Notes

title: [nuxt-pinia-tailwind] get gists from GitHub API
body:
## Background

We want to show the user a list of their gists.

## Acceptance

- [ ] Get gists from GitHub API
- [ ] For display on main page; data needed:
    - [ ] Name of gist
    - [ ] html_url

## Notes
